title: Blinken Owl
author: Kaydan
description: An owl-themed minibadge with synchronized blinking LEDs that reacts to the main SAINTCON 2024 badge.
specialInstructions: Requires SAINTCON 2024 main badge and 3.3V only. Avoid plugging into 5V headers.
solderingInstructions: Solder LEDs first starting from the center, then the headers, then the optional photodiode.
howToAcquire: Find Kaydan at the 801 Labs table during SAINTCON 2024 evenings, or trade another custom badge.

title: Hex Matrix
author: Alex
description: A dense hexagonal LED matrix minibadge that renders simple animations and reacts to I2C messages from the main badge.
specialInstructions: Update main badge firmware to v1.2 or later for full animation support.
solderingInstructions: Reflow all LEDs first using hot air or a plate, then hand-solder the MCU and connector.
howToAcquire: Distributed at the official SAINTCON registration desk for early check-in and via the CTF prize pool.

title: Retro Blinken
author: Riley
description: A retro-styled minibadge with a row of chunky LEDs and a simple chase pattern.
specialInstructions: Can be powered from either 3.3V or 5V, but do not exceed 5.5V.
solderingInstructions: Through-hole LEDs first, then the DIP microcontroller, then the pin header.
howToAcquire: Trade-only at the hardware village, evenings after talks.

title: Badge Buddy
author: Quinn
description: A companion accessory badge that mounts under the main badge and adds status LEDs.
specialInstructions: Mount using the included standoffs; ensure the connector is fully seated.
solderingInstructions: Pre-soldered. Only optional header pins can be added if you want extra I/O.
howToAcquire: Available at the hardware help desk while supplies last.

title: Glitch Fox
author: Morgan
description: A fox-shaped minibadge with glitchy RGB effects and capacitive touch nose.
specialInstructions: Touch nose sensor to cycle effects; avoid flexing the PCB tail.
solderingInstructions: SMD-only: solder the MCU, then the RGB LEDs, then the capacitive touch pad connections.
howToAcquire: Find Morgan near the CTF area; typically worn on the lanyard.

title: Signal Scout
author: Sam
description: A utility minibadge with a simple RF activity indicator and bargraph LEDs.
specialInstructions: Not a calibrated measurement tool; for blinky fun only.
solderingInstructions: Solder the bargraph module first, then the SMA connector and the headers.
howToAcquire: Offered at a scheduled mini-workshop in the hardware village.

title: Crypto Critter
author: Jamie
description: A small critter badge that lights up when you solve the built-in crypto puzzle.
specialInstructions: Scan the QR on the back to get the puzzle instructions.
solderingInstructions: Through-hole LEDs and resistors, then the pushbutton and headers.
howToAcquire: Given out to participants who complete the crypto challenge.

title: Logic Lattice
author: Taylor
description: A lattice of LEDs driven by a tiny CPLD, demonstrating simple logic constructions.
specialInstructions: Do not hot-plug into unverified badge clones; 3.3V only.
solderingInstructions: Reflow the CPLD and regulator, then hand-solder the JST and badge connector.
howToAcquire: Trade-only; look for Taylor in the hardware village late nights.

title: Spectrum Sprite
author: Jordan
description: Audio-reactive RGB minibadge that mounts next to the main SAINTCON badge speaker.
specialInstructions: Works best when the main badge audio is set above 50% volume.
solderingInstructions: Solder the MEMS microphone first, then the LEDs, then the connector.
howToAcquire: Available at the audio village table during evening sessions.

title: Badge Beacon
author: Casey
description: A minimalist minibadge with a bright RGB beacon LED and a long-running low-power mode.
specialInstructions: Hold the button for 3 seconds to switch between low-power and beacon modes.
solderingInstructions: Solder the single RGB LED, then the button, then the MOSFET and headers.
howToAcquire: Handed out at the low-power design meetup during the conference.
